edge: The film began as an Eric Warren Singer screenplay titled American Bullshit, and Hustle is a highly fictionalized version of the Abscam scandal.
Russell rewrote Singer's screenplay, replacing the characters with caricatures of their respective real-life figures.
Roven and Richard Suckle producing through Atlas Entertainment initially considered Ben Affleck to direct, before David O. Russell ultimately signed on to helm the film.
Hustle is a highly fictionalized version of the Abscam scandal of the late 1970s and early 1980s.
The film was shot in and around Boston, Massachusetts (such as in Worcester), and in New York City.

Filming was put on hold in the aftermath of the Boston Marathon bombings, with the city in lockdown. After lockdown was lifted, the film wrapped its Boston shoot and spent its final few days of production in New York City.
